# Elder Helper Services
## Overview
Correctional Service Canada (CSC) is seeking a contractor to provide Elder Helper Services to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders in federal institutions.

## Procurement Details
### Solicitation Number
21465-25-4712577

### Tender Closing Date
2024-05-06T14:00:00

### Expected Contract Start Date
2024-05-15

### Expected Contract End Date
2025-03-31

## Scope of Work
The contractor will provide Elder Helper services to support the work of Elders and the interdisciplinary team. The services will include:

* Assisting Indigenous offenders in benefitting from traditional healing and contemporary treatment interventions
* Ensuring proper traditional protocol is followed when interacting with Elders
* Coordinating and providing supervision for offenders during traditional ceremonies
* Conducting group discussions and teachings on ceremonial objects
* Assisting staff with report writing and technical support for case management and parole processes
* Providing counseling services to offenders when Elders are unavailable

## Essential Requirements
To be considered, the contractor must demonstrate the following:

* A minimum of two (2) years of cumulative experience in assisting and supporting Elders
* Ability to provide counseling and guidance according to traditional teachings
* Experience in conducting group discussions and assisting with report writing
* Knowledge of traditional ceremonies and practices

## Procurement Strategy
This procurement is set aside for an Indigenous supplier in accordance with the Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB). Only suppliers who meet the definition of an Indigenous business as defined in the PSIB may submit a statement of capabilities.

## Statement of Capabilities
Interested suppliers must submit a statement of capabilities, including their experience and qualifications, by the closing date and time.
